content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining and Processing Facility at Position (x=-23.0, y=-68.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=-23.0, y=-68.0)
- Transport Belts connecting the mining drill to a wooden chest and other entities
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-23.5, y=-69.5) storing copper ore
- Additional Transport Belts forming a network for material movement

### Iron Plate Production Line at Position (x=-19.0, y=-65.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-19.0, y=-65.0)
- Burner Inserter at position (x=-17.5, y=-64.5) moving items into the furnace
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-16.5, y=-64.5) storing iron plates
- Belt Group connecting the furnace to the chest

### Iron Ore Mining and Transport System at Position (x=-14.0, y=-53.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=-14.0, y=-53.0)
- Transport Belts moving iron ore to a wooden chest
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-12.5, y=-54.5) storing iron ore
- Burner Inserter at position (x=-13.5, y=-54.5) facilitating ore movement

### Centralized Storage and Processing Hub at Position (x=0.0, y=0.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (x=0.0, y=0.0)
- Wooden Chests at positions (x=1.5, y=0.5) and (x=3.5, y=0.5) for storing various materials
- Burner Inserter at position (x=2.5, y=0.5) managing material transfer between chests

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when placing entities on occupied tiles
- Ensure the target tile is free of other entities before attempting to place a new entity. This can be achieved by checking the tile's occupancy status prior to placement.

### Attribute Errors when accessing non-existent attributes
- Verify that the object in use supports the attributes being accessed. For example, ensure that the object is of the correct type before attempting to access its attributes.
